subject: Physical Fitness
title: Stress and Injury Risk
description: A micro-lesson that makes Stress and Injury Risk usable.

hook.text: Athletes get more injuries during exam weeks, divorce, and job loss. Psychological stress breaks bodies.

buildup.text: Stress hormones like cortisol impair tissue repair, reduce sleep quality, and lower immune function.

discovery.text: Stressed individuals also have reduced peripheral attention. They literally don't see hazards as well.

twist.text: Life stress and training stress share the same recovery pool. A stressful week at work means your body has less to give.

climax.text: Smart coaches reduce training intensity during high-stress life periods. Total stress load matters.

punchline.text: Your body doesn't separate life stress from gym stress. Same recovery account.

quiz.question: How does psychological stress affect injury risk?
options: It impairs recovery, attention, and immune function, raising injury risk
It has no physical effect on the body
It only affects mental health, not physical health
